track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

    n,m,x = [int(n),int(m),int(x)]
    a = list(map(int, input().strip().split(' ')))
    b = list(map(int, input().strip().split(' ')))

model.name: Game of Two Stacks
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin","r");
fscanf($handle,"%d",$g);
for($a0 = 0; $a0 < $g; $a0++){
    fscanf($handle,"%d %d %d",$n,$m,$x);
    $a_temp = fgets($handle);
    $a = explode(" ",$a_temp);
    array_walk($a,'intval');
    $b_temp = fgets($handle);
    $b = explode(" ",$b_temp);
    array_walk($b,'intval');
    // your code goes here
}

?>

model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

g = gets.strip.to_i
for a0 in (0..g-1)
    n,m,x = gets.strip.split(' ')
    n = n.to_i
    m = m.to_i
    x = x.to_i
    a = gets.strip
    a = a.split(' ').map(&:to_i)
    b = gets.strip
    b = b.split(' ').map(&:to_i)
    # your code goes here
end
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    g_temp <- getLine
    let g = read g_temp :: Int
    forM_ [1..g] $ \a0  -> do
        n_temp <- getLine
        let n_t = words n_temp
        let n = read $ n_t!!0 :: Int
        let m = read $ n_t!!1 :: Int
        let x = read $ n_t!!2 :: Int
        a_temp <- getLine
        let a = map read $ words a_temp :: [Int]
        b_temp <- getLine
        let b = map read $ words b_temp :: [Int]
        -- your code goes here


getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Find the maximum number of integers Nick can remove from the stacks without the sum of the removed integers exceeding some x.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          g_t (read-line) 
          g (Integer/parseInt g_t) 
        ]

      (
        loop [a0 g]
        (when (> a0 0)

          (
            let [
              n_temp (read-line) 
              n_t (split n_temp #"\s+") 
              n (Integer/parseInt (n_t 0)) 
              m (Integer/parseInt (n_t 1)) 
              x (Integer/parseInt (n_t 2)) 
            ]
          )

          (
            let [
              a_temp (read-line) 
              a_t (split a_temp #"\s+") 
              a (map #(Integer/parseInt %) a_t) 
            ]
          )

          (
            let [
              b_temp (read-line) 
              b_t (split b_temp #"\s+") 
              b (map #(Integer/parseInt %) b_t) 
            ]
          )

        ; your code goes here
        (recur (- a0 1) ) )
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [G]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    G_list = lists:seq(1,G),
    lists:foreach( fun(G0) ->
            { ok, [N,M,X]} = io:fread("", "~d~d~d"),
            A = read_array(N,"~d"),
            B = read_array(M,"~d"),
            % your code goes here
    end,G_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
g = io.read("*number", "*l")
a0 = 0
while a0 < g do
    n,m,x = io.read("*number", "*number", "*number", "*l")
    a = {}
    a_temp = io.read()
    a_i = 1;
    for token in string.gmatch(a_temp, "[^%s]+") do
    	a[a_i] = token
    	a_i = a_i + 1
    end
    b = {}
    b_temp = io.read()
    b_i = 1;
    for token in string.gmatch(b_temp, "[^%s]+") do
    	b[b_i] = token
    	b_i = b_i + 1
    end
    -- your code goes here
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
